how rare are the rarest things in baseball?

Everybody knows you don't see a perfect game every day. We don't see them every year and, well, the 70s' baseball maniacs like us didn't see one. Yeah, a perfect game is pretty rare by every standard, less than 0.1% of a season worth games.

What about the next best thing, a no-hitter? Also not that common. Triple-plays? About as unusual, which a bit of a surprise, right? And then there are the cycle (and the natural one), grand slams, walk-off balks, complete games — species in risk of extinction — and a whole bunch of other quirky baseball feats that are what make us love the game.

But how rare those things really are???

Triple plays are somewhat of a surprise. I'd think they would happen more often then in reality. The fact is they are just slightly less rare than a no-hitter, happening about 4-5 times a season. But what about the 1974 season, when no triple plays were turned?
